newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KFC says Ting quits on own free will.
newsitem.headline: KFC says Ting quits on own free will.

text.p: Malaysia fast food retailer KFC Holdings Bhd said on Friday its chief executive officer and managing director George Ting had resigned on his own free will.
"Mr George Ting Yew Tong resigned on his own free will so as to devote more time and develop his personal/private businesses after divesting his entire stake in the company," KFC said in a statement.
KFC earlier this week said Ting had quit his posts in the company, raising speculation that there may have been disagreements at board level.
It said group executive director Harris Beh has been actively managing the company with key shareholder Ishak Ismail since April 1996.
KFC said a new franchise agreement naming Ishak as the shareholders' representative has been presented to KFC to reflect the change in major shareholders.

Ting's departure had also raised speculation it would jeopardise the fast-food franchise agreement between the company and U.S.-based Pepsico Inc. The previous clause named Ting as the representative for KFC.
The statement said KFC performed well in the first quarter of this year, making the company "confident that it will achieve another creditable performance for the coming year".
Without giving details, it said KFC Restaurants sales increased by 30 percent, Pizza Hut sales by 54 percent and sales of the integrated poultry business by 21 percent.
The feedmill division registered a 170 percent sale increase in the first quarter compared to the same period last year, while other supporting businees received sales boost of 37 percent.
